summary:
Katrina received her PhD in Molecular Cancer Biology at Duke University in the lab of Dr. Corinne Linardic. She studied cell signaling in rhabdomyosarcoma using cell lines and mouse xenografts with particular focus on the Hippo and Notch signaling pathways. Katrina  also completed the Duke Graduate School's Certificate in College Teaching where she gained teaching experience by TAing for the undergraduate Intro to Molecular Biology lab. 

Katrina was a Rally Postdoctoral Research Fellow in the lab of Dr. Lee Helman at CHLA. Her work focused on novel therapies in pediatric sarcomas including osteosarcoma and rhabdomyosarcoma. She is now a Scientist in Oncology Research at Amgen in Thousand Oaks, CA.

When she is not in lab, Katrina loves to dance and spend time with her family, friends, and her cats.


Areas of Expertise:
•	Cell and Molecular Biology
•	Cancer Biology
•	Mammalian cell culture- leukemia and solid tumor cell lines, primary cells, 2D and 3D
•	qPCR, RT-PCR, MS-PCR
•	Immunoblots, immunoprecipitations, chromatin immunoprecipitations
•	In vivo murine modeling- orthotopic and subcutaneous xenografts, luciferase imaging, drug delivery by IP, SQ, oral gavage
•	Immunohistochemistry, immunofluorescence
•	Lentivirus and retrovirus genetic engineering
•	Microscopy
headline: Sr Scientist at Amgen

publications.name: Secreted frizzled related protein 3 (SFRP3) is required for tumorigenesis of PAX3-FOXO1-positive alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma.
Role of the YAP Oncoprotein in Priming Ras-Driven Rhabdomyosarcoma.
RECENT INSIGHTS INTO NOTCH SIGNALING IN EMBRYONAL RHABDOMYOSARCOMA
Estradiol induces gene proximity and MLL-MLLT3 fusion in an activation-induced cytidine deaminase-mediated pathway.
A Novel Notch-YAP Circuit Drives Stemness and Tumorigenesis in Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma.
The Transcriptional Coactivator TAZ Is a Potent Mediator of Alveolar Rhabdomyosarcoma Tumorigenesis.
Targeting Hippo-Dependent and Hippo-Independent YAP1 Signaling for the Treatment of Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma
A method to culture human alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma cell lines as rhabdospheres demonstrates an enrichment in stemness and notch signaling
LRRC15 antibody-drug conjugates show promise as osteosarcoma therapeutics in preclinical studies

message.text:
I am expanding my private practice to 4 chairs and urgently require interest from Dental professionals!


🌟 We're Expanding Our Team! 🌟

Our bustling private practice in the heart of the Central West is on the lookout for passionate dental professionals to bridge the dental health gap in our community. We have opportunities for:
General Dentists
Specialists (Endodontists, Periodontists)
Opportunities & Benefits:
Flexible Work Arrangements: Full-time or FIFO, with negotiable days and hours.
Immediate Start Needed: Our practice is in high demand, booked out five weeks ahead!
Attractive Earnings: We offer a highly competitive compensation model.
Continuing Education: Includes fully funded training, such as implant fellowships with the Australasian Implant Academy.
Clinical Autonomy & Advanced Technology: Enjoy full clinical autonomy and a fully digital workflow with onsite 3D printing and CAD/CAM.
Additional Perks:
Relocation Bonus: Available for the right candidate.
International Applicants Welcome: Encouraging applications from registered dental practitioners in Australia, the UK, and Ireland.
Visa Sponsorship & Relocation Support: Available for candidates moving from the UK, Ireland, or Scotland.
Join us to make a significant impact on our community's dental health. We can't wait to welcome you aboard! 🦷✨

If you would like to find out more about these positions please email or call me on 0407 283 253 or warrick@delroyparkdental.com.au

It was an honor to attend the Australian Dental Council Assessors, Examiners & Item Writers conference yesterday, and a Happy 30th Year Celebration 🎉 
It was also a time to say farewell to the magnificent Narelle Mills, the outstanding achievements that you have made have only made the ADC stronger and more Inclusive. A huge thank you to all my wonderful colleagues Roisin McGrath PhD Karen Smart Denise Higgins, PhD Murray Thomas Chris Bourke Martin Webb Alex Park Sonia Romeo Veronica Vele University of Melbourne Indigenous Dental Association of Australia any many others for all the hard work you do to ensure our profession keeps growing strong
